ISSUE.TITLE: Arguments order and path
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Contrary to what now --help prints, the path must appear first in the arguments. Using now 8.3.9, I get the following behavior. This works and publishes the ```build``` directory: ``` now ./build --static --name chaud --public ``` But this publishes the current directory, ignoring ```./build```: ``` now --static --name chaud --public ./build ```

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Ensured correct arguments order This closes #909
